result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin A Jensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent to his sentence he is now serving

superMiscConds.notes: 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robin A Jensen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

2:38 p.m. Defendant Robin A Jensen in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Robin A Jensen in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Prison Sentence: 18 mo Incarcerated and 6 mo Extended Supervision, costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests a prison sentence. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests jail time. 
Court summarizes facts and options of sentencing. 

BY THE COURT:*****
Determinate Sentence of 2 yrs Prison Sentence:  1 yr 3 mo Incarceration, concurrent to his sentence he is now serving and 9 mo Extended Supervision, not eligible challenge, marking eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Extended Supervision conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
87 days credit

Defendant is remanded to the Portage County jail/Prison system.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robin A Jensen appeared by video. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

$500 sig bond:  No contact with Jennifer Furger.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
 No contact with Beltz - no standing in line there.

1:22 P.m.
ADA Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant.  On a PO hold.
BTC:  $500 sig bond:  No contact with Jennifer Furger.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. No contact with Beltz - no standing in line there.  

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  03-23-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
